name: Tomato Late Blight
description: A devastating disease of tomato and potato plants, caused by the fungus-like organism Phytophthora infestans. It appears as pale green, water-soaked spots on tomato leaves.

stages.Early: Small, irregular, dark, water-soaked spots on the leaves of the tomato plant.
stages.Advanced: Lesions enlarge, turning brown to black, with a white moldy growth on the underside of leaves. The tomato fruit can also develop large, firm, brown blotches.

causes: The oomycete Phytophthora infestans, which thrives in cool, moist conditions.
risk_factors: High humidity (>90%), cool temperatures (60-70°F / 15-21°C), and prolonged leaf wetness.
preventive_measures: Ensure proper spacing for air circulation, water at the base of tomato plants, use resistant varieties, and rotate crops.
solution: Apply fungicides containing mancozeb or chlorothalonil. Remove and destroy infected tomato plants to prevent spread.
